I don't know where to put this, so I'll just plop it here.

Anyways, I'm going to get a PC. Right now, I'm on a horrible laptop that can barely run stock KSP. However, I have found a PC that looks like it could be good, but I'm asking you guys to tell me. So, could this run KSP with 30+ mods?

Specs:Windows 8.1 64

AMD Quad-Core A6-5200 APU with Radeon HD 8400 Graphics (2 GHz, 2 MB cache)

8 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 (1 x 8 GB)

So, is this worth the $460 price, to run KSP/ other games?
I think it is, since if you make $1000+ from making KSP vids, it would be worth it.

Ha! I sure wish... seriously though I'm in [REDACTED] School, I'm just saving up. But would it be what one considers a 'Beefy' computer?

Edited October 27, 2014 by xXIndestructibleEVAXx
I think so.
Hmmm... well, I want more than 1 persons opinion on this, but since it's around that time where activity on here grinds to a stop, I think I'll wait till tomorrow.

No. It's not a 'beefy' computer. It's a sidegrade, maybe a very slight upgrade to your horrible laptop. Sorry. Also, there is a thread in this forum for PC building/buying tips

Um, I am by no means an expert, but I think not. That CPU has pretty low performance per core, which makes it not good for KSP. It is not a very good cpu in general, and I doubt you'd bet much performance out of it.

Your graphics card would probably work for KSP, just minimally.

Give me a second and I'll try to look up a better computer.

Your graphics card would probably work for KSP, just minimally.

The GPU is integrated into the CPU and is very poor. This laptop has Intel HD Graphics 4000, which is slightly better than that integrated GPU, and at half res in KSP, no AA, I get 9 fps. It simply won't do.

Edited October 25, 2014 by swiftgates24

Is this a laptop? If it's a desktop, you should get either an Intel Core i5-4000 series processor or an AMD FX-8350 for the CPU. As for the GPU, an Nvidia GTX 750 or AMD Radeon 7770 should do the trick. These are the most cost effective options I can think of.

I bought my computer for $600 CAD and it has an FX-8350, Radeon 7770, and 10GB of RAM.

nah, can't build one, don't know how or have the time. I looked up the CPU on a website, rated a 4. looked up the Graphics card, got a two. Could it run ksp with, say, KSP, Renassaince Pack?

You can always build your own. I've only built 2 and replaced parts in 3 but it's pretty easy. For 450-600 USD you can build something that can run KSP for sure. Maybe not on max settings but depending on whether or not you have stuff running in the background all the time you could run quite a few mods.
I'd get a cheap PC with a decent CPU, then buy a graphics card separately. That's if you're absolutely not willing to build one.

It is really easy to build a computer. Just look up a couple labelled pictures and plug things in. The literal hardest part is making the cables neat, otherwise it just takes some time. It is fine to build it over the period of a month, which is what I essentially did, so you can spend all of the time you lag in KSP on your laptop building a computer better than any you can buy. There is tons of help on the forum too.
